name: consonantal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to consonants (= the speech sounds or letters of the alphabet that are not vowels): Dialect variation typically concerns vowels, or words, and more rarely consonantal differences. The Appendix presents features of consonantal sounds in Arabic. the consonantal combination "pl" Compare
vocalic
More examplesFewer examplesAlliteration is the repetition of a consonantal sound or sounds, while assonance is the repetition of a vowel sound.Russian past tense verbs agreeing with feminine and neuter nouns end in vowels, while past tense verbs agreeing with masculine nouns have a consonantal ending.Hebrew orthography is generally consonantal, with the vowels represented by a special system of diacritics.
